history.narrative: Law 6-204, the “District of Columbia Guardianship, Protective Proceedings, and Durable Power of Attorney Act of 1986,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-7, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 18, 1986, and December 16, 1986, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 8, 1987, it was assigned Act. No. 6-263 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
